messages.subject: ADD and Dyslexic help
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all, I have a friend whose 9 yr old daughter has just been tested and diagnosed as ADD and Dyslexic.  Before taking her out of public school she was on
messages.messageBody:
Hi all,
I have a friend whose 9 yr old daughter has just been tested and diagnosed
as ADD and Dyslexic. Before taking her out of public school she was on
medication, but only for a short while.

She would like to try something, anything, before putting her child back on
medication. I know there are books out there and/or programs which address
diet and homeopathic remedies.

Can any of you make suggestions?
TIA
Cindy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] ADD and Dyslexic help
messages.msgSnippet: Cindy- I ve never read it, but have you seen Dr. William Sears ADD Book? I really respect him in all other areas of parenting that I ve read, so I wouldn t
messages.messageBody:
Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] ADD and Dyslexic help Cindy-
   I've never read it, but have you seen Dr. William Sears' ADD Book? I really respect him in all other areas of parenting that I've read, so I wouldn't doubt I'd agree with what he says regarding ADD. I have a feeling he'll talk quite a bit about ADD's connection with food. Has your friend explored that possibility at all?

--
Amy Nelson
Mama to Accalia (6/14/99)
"The hardest to learn was the least complicated." - The Indigo Girls
